name: owlbear gastrolith
description: This strangely shaped rock was once a part of an owlbear's complex digestive system, creating a link between owl throat and bear stomach.  It is possible that it could serve a similar purpose in alchemy, helping to bind together two disparate halves.
//: In terms of alchemy the gastrolith could serve to combie different effects, such as safely mixing together potions, or it could be used as an element of change, such as for shapechanging potions.

name: stone shell
description: The broken fragment of an owlbear egg.  With luck it might still contain some of its former power, though if nothing else it's still a bit sharp.
//: Potion recipes that require a full owlbear egg could also instead require larger amounts of stone shell.  Since 1 egg gives 3 shells, you could perhaps have 1 egg be equivalent to 5 or more shells when making potions.

description: This bracelet has runes engraved on it.  You sense a faint air of mysticism when you look at it.  It would be useful for imbuing mana into material.
This bracelet has runes engraved on it.  You sense a faint air of mysticism when you look at it.  It would be useful for imbuing mana into material.
A wooden band with copper trimmings to be worn on the head.  Touching your temples with it on makes you feel very calm.
A wooden band with silver trimmings to be worn on the head.  Touching your temples with it on makes you feel very calm.
Strong alcohol, infused with mana and concentrated into a liquid that can stabilize spells into liquid form.  You can still drink it, if you want.
Pure ethanol saturated with magical energy.  The sheer power concentrated within causes the surface of the potion to ripple continuously.
An organ located above the kidneys responsible for secretion of adrenaline, cortisol, and aldosterone.  This one is huge, whether by nature or mutation.

name: glow dust
description: The powdered remains of a will-o-wisps's physical form.  It seems to still possess an otherworldly glow.

name: magical reading light
description: Powered by the magic of glow powder and lesser mana potions, this extremely expensive little light will provide just enough light to read by for at least a decade.  Use it to close the cover and hide the light.

Powered by the magic of glow powder and lesser mana potions, this extremely expensive little light will provide just enough light to read by for at least a decade.  The cover is closed.  Use it to open the cover and show the light.

name: bulette plate
description: The great plates from behind a bulette's head have always been prized for use in shield and armor making.

name: bulette pearl
description: As a bulette burrows through the earth its gills collect minute amounts of precious metals and gems which slowly aggregate into lustrous gemstones prized for their beauty and power.
This is the magical essence from a dragon, distilled into a concentrated form.
A long sucking apparatus harvested from stirge corpse.  Makes a poor melee weapon.
A piece of demon spider exoskeleton.  It is light and very durable, and probably has some magical properties.
Pieces of demon spider exoskeleton, bundled tightly together for storage.  Disassemble to unpack.

name: demon chitin plate
description: A large piece of demon spider exoskeleton, painstakingly cut from the corpse of an adult demon spider.  A plate of this size can be used to create armor plating.

name: demon spider fang
description: A fang from a demon spider.  It seems to still drip with poison; you might be able to use this in some alchemical recipe?

Alumentum is magically processed coal or charcoal.  It burns as hot as magnesium, and for a significantly longer period of time.  One of the very few magical materials that is still produced in any quantity today due to its usefulness.

name: mana dust
description: Crystalized mana in powdered form.  It faintly pulses with arcane energy.

name: mana pearl
description: A gemstone created by alchemy.  You can feel it attract surrounding mana.
Wood that has been infused with mana.

Mana bombs are powerful explosive devices developed by a little-known alchemist group for use against enemy spellcasters.  These bombs are fueled by pure arcane energy and can kill instantly.  The exact workings are unclear, but they appear to use some kind of massive mana burn.

use_action.msg: You mix the contents of the bottle, and it starts to sizzle.

description: The liquid in the bottle is sizzling.  Throwing it away from you, preferably at an enemy, would be a very good idea.

use_action.message: The reaction has already started - all you can do is get it away from you!

description: A pair of stabilized alchemist bombs with concentrated mana linking them.  Any movement in the mana linkage zone provokes an extremely powerful explosion in a small area.
